instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Doesn't load
threads.message: I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that doesn't load any drive at all. I've tried external usb hard drive but it just stays at 75 prosent when loading. Can't run ASD because of the issue.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Doesn't load
threads.message:
Got the ASD running.  [COLOR=#454545][FONT=Helvetica]VP0R PBus test1 Sensor reading below low point. Only one error.

When its plugged to charger it works just fine without any issues but when it runs from battery its slow...[/FONT][/COLOR]

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Doesn't load
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Doesn't load
threads.message: Fixed the issue. Corrosion around <TRANSISTOR>Q5300</TRANSISTOR>. Pin 3 had a broken line and the <RESISTOR>R5301</RESISTOR> resistor was bad. Now works fine!
